metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7839 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Control characters prepended before "javascript:" URLs pasted in the addressbar can cause the leading characters to be ignored and the pasted JavaScript to be executed instead of being blocked. This could be used in social engineering and self-cross-site-scripting (self-XSS) attacks where users are convinced to copy and paste text into the addressbar. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 57.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-testsuite - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
